content.title: Educational Assistance For Children Of Victims Of Crime
content.department: Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala
content.details: The scheme 'Educational Assistance for Children of Victims of Crime' was launched to provide educational assistance for children of survivors (victims) of crime. The dependents of survivors (victims) including children find it difficult to continue their studies due to financial constraints since the family has to meet the treatment expenses.
benefits: ₹3000/- per year for children studying in classes 1 to 5
₹5000/- per year for children studying in classes 6 to 10
₹7500/- per year for Higher Secondary students
₹15,000/- per year for PG/M.Phil course students
eligibility: The applicant should be a native and resident of Kerala State.
The children/dependents of survivors (victims) of crime are eligible to apply under the scheme.
The combined annual income of the families should be less than ₹1,00,000/-.

The children pursuing a degree and higher education courses in government and aided institutions and admitted to merit seats in unaided institutions are eligible for financial assistance in courses from the degree level onwards.
exclusions: Families of those killed in road accidents will not be allowed from this scheme.
Children who are receiving funds from other financial assistance schemes will not be allowed.
content.application_process: Online and Offline. Applicants need to register on the SUNEETHI- Online Service Application Portal.
documents_required: Certificate from the school attended by the student
Certificate from Ward Councillor/Member or Panchayat/Nagar Sabha Chairperson/Chairman or Local Station House Officer
Copy of Bank Passbook- Joint bank account details of student and parent

faqs.question: What is the 'Educational Assistance for Children of Victims of Crime' scheme?
faqs.answer: The Government of Kerala has launched this scheme which provides educational assistance for children of survivors (victims) of crime.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Social Justice Department, Government of Kerala.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to get the benefits under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The children/dependents of survivors (victims) of crime are eligible to apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for the children of survivors (victims) of crime?
faqs.answer: Yes, this scheme is only for the children of survivors (victims) of crime.

faqs.question: What is the income criterion to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The combined annual income of the families should be less than ₹1,00,000/-.
